**Circadian Rhythm**: I would rely on my body's natural circadian rhythm to schedule my day. This means waking up and going to bed at the same time each day, allowing my body to adjust to a consistent sleep-wake cycle.

**Pomodoro Technique**: I would use the Pomodoro Technique, which involves working in 25-minute intervals, followed by a 5-minute break. This approach can help me manage my time effectively without relying on a clock.

**Task Prioritization**: I would prioritize tasks based on their importance and urgency, focusing on the most critical ones first. This approach would help me manage my time efficiently and ensure that I'm making the most of my day.

**Scheduling Apps**: I would use a scheduling app on my phone or computer to track my time and appointments. These apps often use built-in clocks or other time-keeping mechanisms to help users stay on schedule.
**Meal Times**: I would use my meal times as a reference point for scheduling my day. By eating at regular intervals, I can estimate the time between meals and use that to structure my day.
